timeline.bodyText: This seems likely to work fine, though for future reference I think it's fine to just make them as external links (i.e. use xxx.html instead of <>) in the context of both books. That's what we did for links in release highlights and breaking changes (e.g. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elastic-stack/current/elasticsearch-highlights.html) which are re-used in both the Installation/Upgrade Guide and individual product books.
timeline.author: lcawl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -517,13 +517,23 @@ Function: `non_zero_count`.
 [[ootb-ml-jobs-siem]]
 === SIEM
 
-// tag::siem-jobs[]
 These {anomaly-jobs} appear by default in the Anomaly Detection interface of the 
 {siem-guide}/machine-learning.html[SIEM app] in {kib}. They help you 
 automatically detect file system and network anomalies on your hosts. The list 
 below contains the jobs organized by `agent.type` (Auditbeat, Packetbeat, and 
 Winlogbeat).
 
+// tag::siem-jobs[]

replies.bodyText: I'll do this now as it keeps thing simple.
